update.description:
**UPDATE:** 2c12b9833336 keeps the color control characters out of the log file (but still sends them to the terminal).

Add an ostream-like class with a << operator that can print to a console and a
file. All messages go to ~/.sdformat/sdformat.log. Error, Warning, and Msg
messages additionally go to stderr.

Two inelegant aspects of this implementation:

1. The control characters that colorize the console output also go to the log
file, making it slightly less readable.
1. The Console::ConsoleStream class does not fully implement the ostream spec;
e.g., you can't pass std::endl to it.

With the new logging system in place, I made two changes to what is logged, at
what level:

1. On the assumption that they were commented out to avoid console spam,
I uncommented all the working sdfdbg invocations in parser_urdf.cc.
1. Demoted two common messages in parser_urdf.cc from sdfwarn to sdfdbg.

Once we're happy with a mechanism like this, we should consider back-porting it to [Gazebo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issue/79).
update.title: Log messages to file (#8)

content.html: More style fixes in e2afbbd

content.raw:
In fe01032, I converted a few `sdfwarn`'s to `sdfdbg` to match [gazebo pull request 533](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/533/make-gazebo-produce-less-console-output/diff#chg-gazebo/sdf/interface/parser.cc) and [gazebo pull request 568](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/568/removed-warning-about-using-a-urdf-as-a/diff).

That's for you @davetcoleman
content.html:
In fe01032, I converted a few sdfwarn's to sdfdbg to match gazebo pull request 533 and gazebo pull request 568.

That's for you @davetcoleman

content.raw: The problem was that the output wasn't being flushed to disk.  Fixed in 873ca56615f9 by storing a shared_ptr, instead of a bare pointer, to the Console singleton, and counting on the shared_ptr to get destructed on exit.
content.html: The problem was that the output wasn't being flushed to disk. Fixed in 873ca56615f9 by storing a shared_ptr, instead of a bare pointer, to the Console singleton, and counting on the shared_ptr to get destructed on exit.

content.raw: I just tried to test the logging to a file by adding a unit test for Console in 821a5e9 (branch [issue_8_2_scpeters](#!/osrf/sdformat/compare/issue_8_2_scpeters..issue_8_2). I can't seem to generate any output in `~/.sdformat/sdformat.log` with this test. Is it just me?
content.html: I just tried to test the logging to a file by adding a unit test for Console in 821a5e9 (branch issue_8_2_scpeters. I can't seem to generate any output in ~/.sdformat/sdformat.log with this test. Is it just me?

content.raw: With this change in sdformat + gazebo_1.9 + drcsim_2.7, I can launch `atlas_utils/atlas_sandia_hands.launch` with no console messages coming from the parser, which is good.  On the other hand, the log file (`~/.sdformat/sdformat.log`) is 11K lines long.  It could be that I enabled too many of the `sdfdbg` calls in the URDF parsers.  @hsu, any opinion on that?
content.html: With this change in sdformat + gazebo_1.9 + drcsim_2.7, I can launch atlas_utils/atlas_sandia_hands.launch with no console messages coming from the parser, which is good. On the other hand, the log file (~/.sdformat/sdformat.log) is 11K lines long. It could be that I enabled too many of the sdfdbg calls in the URDF parsers. @hsu, any opinion on that?
